title: (x) calligraphic Oriental style from book design - calligraphy, Codex {Lex}
content:
Anyone? Interested in the “TAO and “ZEN” as well as the subtitle on the Tao image.

-t

| --- | --- |

 [‹ (x) Natwest corporate face - proprietary face by David Freda Quay Design and Sack {Rainer}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071816/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20483 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Friedrich Racing black serif and script - Broadview, Marker Felt {Bryan Malley} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071816/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20529 "Go to next forum topic")
author: timfm

comments.content:
I’m going to guess that TAO and ZEN are hand-drawn with a brush. The subtitles are on the tip of my tongue. I want to say Carolus Roman, but that’s not right.

- Lex

It’s [Codex](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071816/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.107927.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=ABUNDANCE&sampleSize=48) by Georg Trump (With fake small caps).

- Lex

you might like some of the brush fonts at: [http://www.hunglandesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071816/http:/www.hunglandesign.com/loadfont.htm)

seb

a.k.a. Calligraphic 421

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/calligraphic-421/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071816/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/calligraphic-421/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/calligraphic-421/")

or FF Humanist (with small caps)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-humanist/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071816/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-humanist/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-humanist/")

Thank you all. Great info, tips, and links as always!

-t
